definition: to watch from a height or distance/to keep a lookout
to watch from a height or distance/to survey
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards

sentences.english: The promenade ends with the stairs leading up to the museum's observation tower.
sentences.chinese: 長廊終止於直通博物館瞭望塔的樓梯。

sentences.english: In addition to the Pavilion and the Greenhouse, the exhibition will include a 13 story-tall observation tower.
sentences.chinese: 除了館和溫室，該展覽還包括一個13層高的瞭望塔。

sentences.english: The doomed pirate in the crow's nest had been right.
sentences.chinese: 那個在瞭望臺上也難逃一死的海盜是對的。

sentences.english: He climbed into the watchtower, but there was no sail.
sentences.chinese: 他爬上瞭望塔，卻看不到船帆。

sentences.english: Kutuzov was looking through a field-glass along the high-road before him.
sentences.chinese: 庫圖佐夫用望遠鏡瞭望着前面的大路。

sentences.english: Outlook's Valerie Sanderson spoke to Harrison Edell.
sentences.chinese: 瞭望樓的瓦萊麗桑德森向哈里森埃德爾說起了這件事。

sentences.english: Keeply look out for vessels and fishing boats not to approach too close to them.
sentences.chinese: 敏銳的瞭望船隻和漁船，切勿過於靠攏。

sentences.english: THE first thing that struck us was the distance between the watchtowers.
sentences.chinese: 第一件使我們喫驚的事是瞭望塔之間的距離。

sentences.english: The outer wall lookout for are used in the shooting and battlements.
sentences.chinese: 城牆外側有供瞭望和射擊用的城垛。

sentences.english: The sound reverberates around the stand.
sentences.chinese: 這個聲音在這個瞭望的小屋迴響。

sentences.english: And here we are already close to this watch-tower.
sentences.chinese: 我們此刻已經非常接近瞭望塔了。

sentences.english: I always love overlooking the attractive stars.
sentences.chinese: 本人總愛瞭望那誘人的星空。

sentences.english: From his spot high in the crow's nest, a pirate trained his spyglass on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 一個海盜從瞭望臺的高處把望遠鏡對準了地平線。

sentences.english: Looking into the canyon from outside divulges a deep and mysterious darkness.
sentences.chinese: 從外部瞭望，峽谷的裂縫透着深而神祕的黑暗。

sentences.english: Standing on this tower, people can see the charming Alps.
sentences.chinese: 站在這個瞭望臺上，可以觀賞到迷人的阿爾卑斯山脈。

sentences.english: In fact this is the vista point of conventional Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 實際上可以說這是一個觀看傳統香港的瞭望臺。

definition: to survey the scene from an elevated position
to gaze afar/to look into the distance
opposite bank (of a body of water)
to warn/to alert/to be on the alert/to stand guard/sentinel
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
